FuncDef:
The ptp sync-interval command sets the interval at which a 1588v2 interface sends Sync packets.
The undo ptp sync-interval command restores the default interval at which a 1588v2 interface sends Sync packets.
By default, the interval for sending Sync messages on an interface is 3. That is, the actual interval for sending Sync messages is 8/1024s.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the interval at which a 1588v2 interface sends Sync packets.
The value of ethernet card is an integer ranging from 0 to 20.
In 1588v2 mode, the default value is 3, which means 8/1024s.In G.8275.1 mode, the default value is 6.In CU-106 mode, the default value is 6.In SMPTE-2059-2 mode, the value ranges from 3 to 9, and the default value is 7.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Two devices exchange Announce packets to determine the master/slave relationship. The master device sends Sync packets to notify the slave device of time signal parameters and uses a delay measurement mechanism to achieve time signals accuracy.
The master interface periodically sends multicast Sync packets. If devices exchange Sync packets frequently and consume a lot of bandwidth resources, increase the sync-interval value. If time synchronization accuracy is low, reduce the sync-interval value.
Prerequisites
1588v2 has been enabled on an interface using the ptp enable command.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
The time when the Sync packets can be stamped into the Sync packets if the one-step timestamping mode is used or into Follow_Up packets if the two-step timestamping mode is used. To specify a timestamping mode, run the ptp clock-step { one-step | two-step } command.
